Translation of 楚竹書・天子建州(en) into English.

p.seg: In general the son of Heaven builds it in the region,
the ruler of the country in the capital,
the daifu in the hamlet,
the shi in the home.
In general 7 generations for the son of Heaven,
5 for the ruler of the country,
3 for the daifu,
2 for the shi. (???)
If the shi imitates the position of the daifu,
he will not escape (punishment) (?) ;
if the daifu imitates the position of the ruler of the country,
he will not escape;
if the rulre of the state imitates the position of the son of Heaven,
he will not escape.
Ritual propriety is the increment (?) of rites.
As for the rites in the ancestral temple,
what is not refined is treated as refined,
what is not beautiful is treated as beautiful.
Righteousness is the opposite of that,
what is refined is treated as not refined,
what is beautiful as not beautiful.
So without ritual propriety there would be great neglect,
without righteousness great sins.
If in acting one merely uses emotions,
the country is lost.
If in every case one uses objects [=external evidence, mere rationality?],
the country is lost.
One must straighten one’s emotions and tie them to objects,
one will careful about capital punishments and the state will be well ruled.
Culture is yin and the military is yang,
one relies on culture to obtain officials,
one relies on the military to obtain agricultural products.
The virtue of culture is to keep good order,
the virtue of the military is to attack,
culture gives birth while the military kills.
When the sun and the moon obtain their order,
and they are rooted in the North Star (?),
the enemies are smashed and lost.
The XX acts harmonizing two things:
one is happiness, one is anger.
The son of Heaven sits by means of the carpenter’s square,
eats by means of the sundial,
stands by means of the plumb line (?),
walks with excitement (a rope?),
XXX,
looks back by turning his body;
the nobles eat with equal appearance (?),
they look (?) the one hundred officers,
when they look back they turn their shoulders,
they have the same rules with the ministers and daifu;
the shi look with constant eye,
when looking back they turn their head.
They cannot but know the rules:
they are the standard of the people.
In general the son of Heaven eats XX,
the ruler of the state eats the coarser of the sacrificial offerings,
the daifu receives what is offered,
the shi receives what is left.
The son of Heaven has four layers of bamboo mats,
the ruler of the state three,
the daifu two,
the shi one.
In serving the ghosts one must behave with respect,
in caring for the people one must use virtue,
in capital punishment one must use grief.
In court one must not discuss private affairs,
in offering tributes one must not discuss war,
on the road one must not discuss hidden affairs,
in attending government affairs one must not discuss music,
while attending banquets one must not regulate important affairs,
in a crowd one must not discuss grievances,
between man and woman one must not discuss shameful things,
between friends one must not discuss separation,
facing food one must not discuss disgusting things.
In dealing with prognostications one must not mention chaos,
one must not mention invasions,
one must not mention destructions,
one must not mention defeat,
one must not mention shortcomings (?),
and so in dealing with (the divinatory) turtles there are (these) five interdictions.
In facing a city wall one must not mention destruction,
in inspecting a state one must not mention loss.
Therefore when one observes an exorcism one makes prayers for it,
when one observes the southeastern corner one enters there. ???
